title: Initial app scaffold with welcome screen and project setup

requirements.text: Create a basic frontend home screen that welcomes the user and prompts them to define what kind of app they want to build (e.g., a short form with fields like “App idea”, “Target users”, and “Key features”), and display the entered text back on the page as a local preview (no persistence required).
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the app shows a clearly labeled welcome screen.
A small form collects at least: App idea, Target users, Key features.
Submitting the form renders a readable summary on the same page without reloading.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement a minimal backend canister endpoint that can be called from the frontend to verify connectivity (e.g., a query method returning a short English status string).
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes at least one query method that returns a status string.
Frontend can call the backend method and render the returned status on the home screen.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, distinct visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) appropriate for a generic app builder welcome experience; avoid blue/purple as primary colors.
acceptanceCriteria: The home screen uses a consistent color palette, typography scale, and spacing system.
Primary color scheme does not use blue/purple as the main accent.
The UI looks intentional (not default browser styling).

constraints: Use React + TypeScript with Tailwind and the existing UI component library without modifying immutable paths under frontend/src/components/ui or the specified immutable hooks files.
Keep all Motoko backend logic in the single actor in backend/main.mo; do not introduce additional backend services.
All user-facing text must be in English.
nonGoals: Data persistence of the form inputs.
